title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4215.3 - Establishment of trust fund
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4215.3 - Establishment of trust fund

State Regulations
(a) The corporation shall establish the trust fund for the deposit of trust fund
proceeds. The trust fund proceeds shall be distributed among and deposited in
minority and women revolving loan trust fund accounts maintained by the
corporation in such amounts as the corporation may determine, and in
administrative expense trust fund accounts established and maintained by the
corporation pursuant to section
4215.4
of this Part. The number of
minority and women revolving loan trust fund accounts and administration
expense trust fund accounts established by the corporation with trust fund
proceeds from the trust fund appropriation shall be limited to the number set
forth in said appropriation. The number of minority and women revolving loan
trust fund accounts and administrative expense trust fund accounts established
by the corporation with trust fund proceeds from the trust fund reappropriation
shall be limited to the number set forth in said reappropriation. (b) The trust fund proceeds deposited in a
minority and women revolving loan trust fund account shall be used solely for
the purposes set forth in section
4215.6
of this Part by
administering corporations that are selected by the corporation in accordance
with section
4215.5
of this Part and serve
service delivery regions for which a minority and women revolving loan trust
fund account is established. Any repayments of loans received by administering
corporations shall be paid to the corporation for redeposit in the minority and
women revolving loan trust fund account from which such loan was
advanced. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4215.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
